subject: Re: [junit] JUnitFactory - an experimental *characterization* test generator
msgSnippet: ...  It sounds excellent, Alberto. Thank you for making it available to the community. I ll have to keep it in mind the next time I m on a Java
messageBody:
albsavoia wrote:

> In "Working With Legacy Code", Michael Feathers define
> characterization tests as tests that characterize and record what the
> code actually does - not what it's *supposed* to do. They exercise the
> code with a range of inputs, and record return values, object state,
> etc., for each set of inputs.
<snip />

It sounds excellent, Alberto. Thank you for making it available to the
community. I'll have to keep it in mind the next time I'm on a Java project.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
